intro: Trymatococcus kamerunianus var. welwitschii, commonly known as the Cameroon star moss, is a rare and delicate liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, star-shaped thallus with a dense covering of tiny, leaf-like structures called phyllidia. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying bryophyte diversity. Due to its fragile nature and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
